description: Returns an MLModel that includes detailed metadata, data source information, and the current status of the MLModel. GetMLModel provides results in normal or verbose format.

parameters.name: MLModelId
parameters.description: The ID assigned to the MLModel at creation.

parameters.name: Verbose
parameters.description: Specifies whether the GetMLModel operation should return Recipe. If true, Recipe is returned. If false, Recipe is not returned.

nested_items.name: MLModelId
nested_items.description: The MLModel ID, which is same as the MLModelId in the request.

nested_items.name: TrainingDataSourceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the training DataSource.

nested_items.name: CreatedByIamUser
nested_items.description: The AWS user account from which the MLModel was created. The account type can be either an AWS root account or an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user account.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The time that the MLModel was created. The time is expressed in epoch time.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The time of the most recent edit to the MLModel. The time is expressed in epoch time.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: A user-supplied name or description of the MLModel.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the MLModel. This element can have one of the following values:
PENDING - Amazon Machine Learning (Amazon ML) submitted a request to describe a MLModel.
INPROGRESS - The request is processing.
FAILED - The request did not run to completion. The ML model isn't usable.
COMPLETED - The request completed successfully.
DELETED - The MLModel is marked as deleted. It isn't usable.

nested_items.name: SizeInBytes
nested_items.description: Long integer type that is a 64-bit signed number.

nested_items.name: EndpointInfo
nested_items.description: The current endpoint of the MLModel.

nested_items.name: PeakRequestsPerSecond
nested_items.description: The maximum processing rate for the real-time endpoint for MLModel, measured in incoming requests per second.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The time that the request to create the real-time endpoint for the MLModel was received. The time is expressed in epoch time.

nested_items.name: EndpointUrl
nested_items.description: The URI that specifies where to send real-time prediction requests for the MLModel.

nested_items.name: EndpointStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the real-time endpoint for the MLModel. This element can have one of the following values:
NONE - Endpoint does not exist or was previously deleted.
READY - Endpoint is ready to be used for real-time predictions.
UPDATING - Updating/creating the endpoint.

nested_items.name: TrainingParameters
nested_items.description: A list of the training parameters in the MLModel. The list is implemented as a map of key-value pairs.

sgd.maxMLModelSizeInBytes - The maximum allowed size of the model. Depending on the input data, the size of the model might affect its performance. The value is an integer that ranges from 100000 to 2147483648. The default value is 33554432.
sgd.maxPasses - The number of times that the training process traverses the observations to build the MLModel. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 10000. The default value is 10.

sgd.shuffleType - Whether Amazon ML shuffles the training data. Shuffling data improves a model's ability to find the optimal solution for a variety of data types. The valid values are auto and none. The default value is none. We strongly recommend that you shuffle your data.

sgd.l1RegularizationAmount - The coefficient regularization L1 norm. It controls overfitting the data by penalizing large coefficients. This tends to drive coefficients to zero, resulting in a sparse feature set. If you use this parameter, start by specifying a small value, such as 1.0E-08. The value is a double that ranges from 0 to MAX_DOUBLE. The default is to not use L1 normalization. This parameter can't be used when L2 is specified. Use this parameter sparingly.

sgd.l2RegularizationAmount - The coefficient regularization L2 norm. It controls overfitting the data by penalizing large coefficients. This tends to drive coefficients to small, nonzero values. If you use this parameter, start by specifying a small value, such as 1.0E-08. The value is a double that ranges from 0 to MAX_DOUBLE. The default is to not use L2 normalization. This parameter can't be used when L1 is specified. Use this parameter sparingly.

nested_items.name: InputDataLocationS3
nested_items.description: The location of the data file or directory in Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3).

nested_items.name: MLModelType
nested_items.description: Identifies the MLModel category. The following are the available types:
REGRESSION --- Produces a numeric result. For example, 'What price should a house be listed at?'
BINARY --- Produces one of two possible results. For example, 'Is this an e-commerce website?'
MULTICLASS --- Produces one of several possible results. For example, 'Is this a HIGH, LOW or MEDIUM risk trade?'

nested_items.name: ScoreThreshold
nested_items.description: The scoring threshold is used in binary classification MLModel models. It marks the boundary between a positive prediction and a negative prediction.

nested_items.name: ScoreThresholdLastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The time of the most recent edit to the ScoreThreshold. The time is expressed in epoch time.

nested_items.name: LogUri
nested_items.description: A link to the file that contains logs of the CreateMLModel operation.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: A description of the most recent details about accessing the MLModel.

nested_items.name: ComputeTime
nested_items.description: The approximate CPU time in milliseconds that Amazon Machine Learning spent processing the MLModel, normalized and scaled on computation resources. ComputeTime is only available if the MLModel is in the COMPLETED state.

nested_items.name: FinishedAt
nested_items.description: The epoch time when Amazon Machine Learning marked the MLModel as COMPLETED or FAILED. FinishedAt is only available when the MLModel is in the COMPLETED or FAILED state.

nested_items.name: StartedAt
nested_items.description: The epoch time when Amazon Machine Learning marked the MLModel as INPROGRESS. StartedAt isn't available if the MLModel is in the PENDING state.

nested_items.name: Recipe
nested_items.description: The recipe to use when training the MLModel. The Recipe provides detailed information about the observation data to use during training, and manipulations to perform on the observation data during training.

nested_items.name: Schema
nested_items.description: The schema used by all of the data files referenced by the DataSource.
